faqs.title: Trackers connect to Wi-Fi but not SlimeVR
faqs.answer: If your trackers are connected to Wi-Fi but are not showing up in SlimeVR, you can find potential fixes at https://docs.slimevr.dev/common-issues.html#the-trackers-are-connected-to-my-wi-fi-but-dont-turn-up-on-slimevr. Also make sure that your network is set to Private, you can follow [the guide from Microsoft for help](https://support.microsoft.com/windows/make-a-wi-fi-network-public-or-private-in-windows-0460117d-8d3e-a7ac-f003-7a0da607448d).

faqs.title: SlimeVR not connected to SteamVR/Feeder App or trackers don't show up in SteamVR
faqs.answer: If SlimeVR reports that it can't connect to SteamVR or the Feeder App, or your trackers are connected to SlimeVR but don't show up on SteamVR, make sure that SlimeVR isn't being run as an administrator and that the "slimevr" driver is turned on in **SteamVR** under **Settings** > **Startup / Shutdown** > **Manage Add-Ons**. You can find additional help at https://docs.slimevr.dev/common-issues.html#the-trackers-are-connected-to-the-slimevr-server-but-arent-turning-up-on-steam. Alternatively, you can use [VRChat OSC Trackers](https://docs.slimevr.dev/server/osc-information.html) to connect to VRChat specifically.

Trackers aren't showing up in SteamVR

faqs.title: Trackers move in the wrong direction
faqs.answer: If your trackers are moving in the wrong direction (ex. leg moves the wrong way when kicking), it's likely your mounting orientation is set incorrectly. You can see ZRock35's video guide at https://youtu.be/SYqfQdVseF4 for help with session calibrations, or find other potential fixes at https://docs.slimevr.dev/common-issues.html#trackers-are-moving-in-the-wrong-direction-when-i-move.

faqs.title: How many trackers are needed?
faqs.answer: Generally, you need at least 5 trackers for full body tracking. You can find a demonstration of 5 to 11 tracker setups in ZRock35's video at https://youtu.be/KN3dxGNAq34. It's not recommended to use less than 5 trackers, as you won't be able to bend your legs (commonly referred to as "Minecraft" legs). You can find a demonstration of 1 to 3 tracker setups in ZRock35's video at https://youtu.be/iKmrNKLacwk. For more information about how many trackers you need, see https://docs.slimevr.dev/slimevr101.html#how-many-trackers-do-you-need.

faqs.title: What are extension trackers?
faqs.answer: Extension trackers (aka. "aux tracker" or "aux IMU") are a single additional tracking point that is connected to a full tracker with a wire. By being connected to a full tracker, it can be smaller as it doesn't require its own microcontroller or battery. You can find more information about extension trackers at https://docs.slimevr.dev/slimevr101.html#what-is-an-extension.

faqs.title: Config and Log Locations
faqs.answer: The app data for SlimeVR is located at "**%AppData%\dev.slimevr.SlimeVR**". The main config file is "**vrconfig.yml**". The logs are stored in the "**logs**" folder, where "**slimevr-server_X.log**" are server logs and "**slimevr_rX.log**" are GUI logs.
keywords: How do I find the logs for SlimeVR
Where is the app data stored

questions: Whats the new location for config and logs now?

faqs.title: Official Trackers - Broken Tracker(s)
faqs.answer: Symptoms of hardware issues that may occur with **Official** trackers include solid blue light (not blinking), suddenly stopping working, overheating, and battery issues. If your tracker is getting very hot when plugged in or turned on, **do not** charge the tracker or turn it on anymore, as it is a potential fire hazard. To get a warranty replacement, fill out the form at https://slimevr.dev/support.

Mandatory sensor 1 not found at address 0x4A

faqs.title: Debugging tracker errors
faqs.answer: To debug a tracker error, you'll need to get the serial logs. To get the serial logs: Open the **Settings** tab of the GUI, open the **Serial console** under the **Utilities** section, **plug the tracker in via USB**, turn the tracker **on**, press the **Reboot** button, and you should see output show up. If you don't see the output, you can also try pressing the reset button on your tracker if available. If this is in regards to a support issue, please show the console output to provide further information.

faqs.title: Why did Crowd Supply push back my order?
faqs.answer: Crowd Supply provides an estimate for when your order will ship, this estimate may change to more accurately reflect the current conditions. The Crowd Supply dates aren't updated frequently and usually the SlimeVR Discord will have information earlier through updates. For the latest information on shipping and production progress, you can check the [#shipping-progress](https://discord.com/channels/817184208525983775/1129107343058153623) and [#updates](https://discord.com/channels/817184208525983775/818062236492759050) channels on the [SlimeVR Discord](https://discord.gg/SlimeVR).

faqs.title: SlimeVR GUI repeatedly timing out
faqs.answer: If your SlimeVR GUI is repeatedly timing out from the SlimeVR server (check the logs), you may be able to fix this by running the following command in an administrator console: `netsh int tcp set supplemental internet congestionprovider=default`
keywords: Connection lost to the server. Trying to reconnect...

faqs.title: Official Trackers - Charging your trackers
faqs.answer: When charging your trackers, a red light will indicate that the battery is charging, a green light will indicate when the tracker is fully charged. It should take approximately 2.5 hours to fully charge from 0% to 100%. The battery percentage reported while the tracker is charging is not accurate and will always report 100%, you should rely on the red and green indicator lights instead.

How long does it take to charge my trackers

faqs.title: Trackers only turn on when plugged in
faqs.answer: If your trackers are only turning on when plugged in or turning off quickly after unplugging, the trackers may be out of battery and need to charge. Try letting the tracker charge for at least 10 minutes or until the charging light is green (note that while plugged in, the tracker will always report 100% battery). If the tracker still doesn't work while unplugged, there may be an issue with the battery.

faqs.title: Resetting body proportions
faqs.answer: You can reset your body proportions by going to the "Body Proportions" tab, click on the "Manual proportions" option, then while in VR with your headset on and standing up straight, click the "Reset all proportions" button in the bottom right corner. If your height is still wrong, then you may need to correct the floor level on your headset. If you do not have a headset connected, this will only reset to the SlimeVR default without scaling to your height.
keywords: How do I reset my proportions
How to reset my body proportions

faqs.title: Session Calibrations Guide
faqs.answer: Performing session calibrations (full reset, yaw reset, mounting reset, etc) correctly is essential to having accurate tracking. For a guide to performing session calibrations, see ZRock35's video at https://youtu.be/SYqfQdVseF4.
keywords: How to do a full reset
How do I do a mounting reset

What pose do I need to do for a yaw reset?
What are session calibrations?

faqs.title: Scanning for WiFi using a tracker
faqs.answer: To perform a WiFi scan on a tracker, you'll need to use the serial console: Open the **Settings** tab of the GUI, open the **Serial console** under the **Utilities** section, **plug the tracker in via USB**, turn the tracker **on**, press the **Reboot** button, and you should see output show up. If you don't see the output, you can also try pressing the reset button on your tracker if available. Once you see output in the serial console, you can press the **Get WiFi Scan** button to perform the WiFi scan. If this is in regards to a support issue, please show the console output to provide further information.
keywords: Perform a WiFi scan on my tracker
How do I scan for WiFi

faqs.title: Automatic body proportions error
faqs.answer: If you're getting an error while attempting automatic body proportions (AutoBone), it is likely that your **mounting orientation** is set incorrectly. Make sure that your tracking is working as expected before fine-tuning body proportions, body proportions only affect the range of motion, not the direction of movement. If your body proportions are incorrect, you may reset your body proportions using the manual proportions tab until you correct the underlying tracking issue.
keywords: Why do I get an error when doing body proportions
questions: I keep getting an error while trying to use automatic body proportions, what am I doing wrong?
Is autobone broken? I get an error every time I use it.

faqs.title: Official Trackers - USB Firmware Recovery
faqs.answer: If you have tried to update the firmware on your **Official** trackers and they are no longer turning on, usually having the blue light only turn on for a quick moment before turning off and not blinking, you may need to recover the firmware over USB. You can find a guide to recovering firmware over USB at https://docs.slimevr.dev/updating-firmware.html#usb-recovery. In the case that you are unable to open the tracker or recovery did not work, you may need to contact SlimeVR support for further help by filling out the form at https://slimevr.dev/support.

faqs.title: My DIY aux tracker isn't working
faqs.answer: In order to make sure your DIY aux tracker is set up, you need to make sure it is set properly in the webflasher. Alternatively, you should ensure that SDO is bridged on your IMU and your soldering is all correct.

faqs.title: Quest Pro controllers cause high latency / lag
faqs.answer: Quest Pro controllers can use 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi to connect to your headset, this can cause interference with SlimeVR trackers since they also use 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi. The easiest current solution is to change the channel that your 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi is on. You can read the Meta support article for Wi-Fi troubleshooting for the Quest Pro controllers here https://www.meta.com/help/quest/articles/getting-started/getting-started-with-quest-pro/wi-fi-troubleshooting-touch-pro-controllers/.

faqs.title: Last tracker won't connect
faqs.answer: Usually, having 1-3 trackers not connecting while the rest connect fine is caused by router issues (mostly Netgear and ISP provided routers). Our general recommendation is restarting the router, if that doesnt work you can find further troubleshooting steps at https://docs.slimevr.dev/common-issues.html#my-tracker-never-connects-to-wi-fi--are-not-appearing-on-the-slimevr-server.

faqs.title: IMU not detected in serial console
faqs.answer: If your serial console shows an error like "is working: false" or "Mandatory sensor 1 not found at address I2C" it is most likely due to a soldering error. Make sure you've thoroughly checked your solder joints to confirm they aren't bridged, are cone-shaped, and have sufficient solder to maintain contact with the PCB.

faqs.title: What are Smol Slimes?
faqs.answer: Smol Slimes are SlimeVR trackers that use the nRF52840 microcontroller instead of the ESP8266. They are smaller, have better battery life, and use a dongle to connect to SlimeVR instead of Wi-Fi. You can find out more at https://docs.slimevr.dev/smol-slimes/index.html.
questions: I keep hearing people talking about smol slimes and I have no clue what they are, are they just supposed to be another case design like meowcarrier or something?

faqs.title: What SlimeVR design should I build?
faqs.answer: As of the July 27th, 2025, the recommended case design for most people is MeowCarrier. You can find a list of designs here: https://docs.slimevr.dev/diy/cases.html.

faqs.title: DIY Trackers - Aux and main trackers combine into one
faqs.answer: If your DIY main and aux trackers show up as one tracker in the SlimeVR server, it's likely because the SDO pads are bridged on both the main and aux IMUs. Make sure the SDO pads don't have any solder on them.
keywords: My main and aux trackers show up as 1
questions: I just built my trackers and im having an issue where my main and aux tracker combine and show up as 1 single tracker in the SlimeVR server, other than this they work completely fine.

faqs.title: Two Smol trackers show up as one
faqs.answer: The most likely cause is that two of your trackers are using the same ID, so the receiver treats them as one. To fix this, type the `clear` command on your trackers and then try pairing again.
keywords: Why do 2 Smol trackers show up as 1
questions: So I am pairing my new stacked smol slimes that I made and when I move 2 of my trackers, they both show up as the same one in the server. How do I fix this?
I just paired 2 smol slimes and when testing them, they both move as 1 tracker.

faqs.title: How do I flash my Smol tracker or receiver?
faqs.answer: You flash your tracker or receiver by putting the device in DFU mode, then flashing it using the UF2 method or the nRF Connect Programmer. For detailed instructions, visit: https://docs.slimevr.dev/smol-slimes/firmware/smol-flashing-firmware.html.
keywords: Is flashing Smols similar to ESP
questions: I just built my smols and now I want to know how to upload the firmware, is it like normal slimes where there is an online webflasher or is it entirely different.
Im stuck on flashing the firmware for my smols, ive tried to look for a flasher online but I havnt seen anything. can someone link me one?

faqs.title: How do I compile my own Smol Slime firmware?
faqs.answer: To compile your own Smol Slime firmware, you will need to clone the repo and install Visual Studio Code with the nRF Connect extension. For more detailed instructions, visit: https://docs.slimevr.dev/smol-slimes/firmware/smol-compiling-firmware.html.
keywords: How to edit pins in Smol firmware
How to edit settings in firmware

I decided I wanted to build my own smol firmware in order to set the pins and settings to my preference, how do I do this?
How do I compile my own firmware for smol slime trackers?

faqs.title: What is the battery life for Smol Slimes?
faqs.answer: The battery life of Smol Slimes depends on the battery size. Typically, a 100mAh battery provides at least 24 hours of use. As of July 27th, 2025, 40 hours of playtime has been achieved on a 100mAh battery.
keywords: What is Smol Slime battery life
What battery to use with smols
questions: So I heard with smol slimes one of the big selling points is that it has an insanely high battery life, just how high is it and on what battery capacity

faqs.title: Why should I use Smol Slimes over regular ones?
faqs.answer: Smol Slimes use the nRF52840 microcontroller, unlike regular Slimes that use the ESP8266. This allows for a smaller size, integrated charging circuit, and improved battery efficiency due to using Nordic's radio protocol (ESB) instead of Wi-Fi. These advantages make them a popular choice for DIY tracking.
keywords: Why should I use Smol Slimes
What is the point of Smol Slimes
questions: so I hear people talking about smol slimes all the time but I never understood why, is it just that they are smaller than normal slimes

faqs.title: What is Stay Aligned?
faqs.answer: Stay Aligned is a feature introduced in SlimeVR v0.16.0. It gradually rotates your trackers toward previously calibrated poses in order to correct drift over time.
questions: I saw one of the big new features of slime is stay aligned, what is this? should I use it?

faqs.title: What are Butterfly Trackers?
faqs.answer: Butterfly Trackers are SlimeVR's **Official** Smol Trackers. You can find out more about them here: https://slimevr.dev/butterfly.

faqs.title: What Smol design should I use?
faqs.answer: As of July 27th, 2025, the most common way of building Smol Slimes is the stacked method, where the IMU sits on top of the SuperMini. For other case designs, visit: https://docs.slimevr.dev/smol-slimes/hardware/smol-slimes-community-builds.html.

faqs.title: What Smol receiver should I use?
faqs.answer: As of July 27th, 2025, the best receiver for Smol Slimes is the Holyiot nRF52840 dongle. For other options and more information you can visit the docs: https://docs.slimevr.dev/smol-slimes/hardware/smol-receiver.html.
keywords: What is the best Smol Slime dongle
What receiver should I use for Smol Slimes

faqs.title: Should I use SPI or I2C for Smol Slimes?
faqs.answer: I2C and SPI are communication protocols used to send data between the IMU and SuperMini. SPI is generally faster and more power-efficient, but currently doesn't support magnetometers. If you need magnetometer support, wire for SPI but use I2C for now to stay compatible with future updates.
keywords: What communication protocol should I use for smols
questions: So I heard you can use the SPI communication protocol now instead of I2C, should I switch over?
If I add the extra 2 wires on my trackers for SPI can I still use I2C on it?

faqs.title: Should I wire mod my Smol Slime?
faqs.answer: It's generally recommended to wire mod your Smol Slimes to improve stability and range. You should also remove the stock ceramic antenna to reduce interference. For more information on the wire mod, visit this section of the docs: https://docs.slimevr.dev/smol-slimes/hardware/smol-tracker.html#-copper-wire-for-wire-antenna-mod.
keywords: Should I keep the stock antenna while wire modding

faqs.title: What straps should I use?
faqs.answer: There are many options for SlimeVR straps, including official straps, Venti straps, or DIY solutions using strap material from AliExpress. For chest tracking, a GoPro chest harness is highly recommended to reduce slipping.
keywords: Should I make my own straps for SlimeVR
questions: I just put together my parts list for my slimes and I was wondering if there are any good strap kits available or if it would be best to order strap material off aliexpress and DIY some togethe.r

faqs.title: What straps should I use for Smol Slimes?
faqs.answer: For Smol Slimes, you can use official straps, Venti straps, or DIY straps based on options listed here: https://docs.slimevr.dev/smol-slimes/hardware/smol-slimes-community-straps.html. A GoPro chest harness is also recommended.
questions: I just put together my parts list for my smol slimes and I was wondering if I should use the same straps as you would with regular slimes or if there are specialised straps for smol slimes.

faqs.title: Where can I find reliable third party sellers?
faqs.answer: Reliable third-party sellers can be found in the [#marketplace-forum](https://discord.com/channels/817184208525983775/1058335815614341240) of the [SlimeVR Discord](https://discord.gg/SlimeVR). Avoid buying from Facebook Marketplace, eBay, Etsy, Amazon, or AliExpress, as these are often overpriced or scams.
keywords: Where can I get good third party trackers
questions: I want to get some SlimeVR trackers but I don't have enough money for the official slimes, are there any sellers that that can offer the same quality trackers but for cheaper? and if so where can I find them.

faqs.title: What firmware version should I flash on my trackers
faqs.answer: The best firmware version to flash is the latest version of the `SlimeVR/Main` branch, as it is the most up-to-date.
questions: I heard that dynamic sfusion is out of date now, whats the best firmware version to use now? is it just back to main?

faqs.title: Should I use the firmware flasher in the server?
faqs.answer: For flashing your trackers you should use the Firmware tool at the bottom of the settings in the SlimeVR Server. If the built-in tool doesn't work or the firmware doesn't build, you can use the web firmware tool at https://slimevr-firmware.bscotch.ca instead.

faqs.title: How do I debug my Smol Slime trackers?
faqs.answer: To debug your Smol Slimes, connect them to your PC and open the serial terminal in nRF Connect. Select your tracker, connect to the port, and you should see debug logs. If not, type `reboot` in the console and press Enter. You can find more information about accessing the serial console and using commands here: https://docs.slimevr.dev/smol-slimes/firmware/smol-pairing-and-calibration.html.
keywords: How do I get Smol Slime logs
questions: So I built my smol slimes and I they arnt working, is there any logs I can get for debugging?
How do I do things like send commands to my smol slimes like putting it in DFU mode or calibrating it? it would also be nice if I could get some kind of log console to debug errors.

faqs.title: What are the buttons for on Smol Slimes?
faqs.answer: Most Smol Slimes have one SW0 button, which is programmable and often used for deep sleep or turning off the tracker. Some designs also have an RST button that resets the tracker. Some uses for this are listed here: https://docs.slimevr.dev/smol-slimes/firmware/smol-pairing-and-calibration.html.
keywords: What is SW0 button on Smol Slime
What is RST button on Smol Slime

faqs.title: What does this LED code mean on my Smol Slime tracker?
faqs.answer: If your Smol Slime is showing an unknown LED blinking pattern, it may be an error indicator. You can reference the codes here: https://docs.slimevr.dev/smol-slimes/smol-LED-codes.html.
keywords: What does this bliking light mean on Smol Slimes
Why do my Smol trackers keep blinking
Why is my LED fading on and off on SuperMini
What does this LED error code mean
